message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the task of estimating semantic similarity and relatedness between biomedical concepts, which is a common problem in natural language processing and information retrieval. The paper proposes a method that combines distributional statistics drawn from text corpora with the structure of existing knowledge resources, which is a common approach in computational linguistics and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to natural language processing and computational linguistics. 

Other likely sub-categories include cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deals with methods for retrieving relevant information from large collections of data, cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics related to statistical learning and data mining, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which covers a broad range of topics related to intelligent systems and agents, and cs.CY (Computers and Society), which covers topics related to the social and ethical implications of computing technologies.
